com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.read
Class ShortcutReadUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.abcodeworks.webshortcututil.read.ShortcutReadUtil

public class ShortcutReadUtil
extends Object

Provides helper functions for reading shortcuts.

This is the preferred class to use for reading shortcuts, because it automatically figures out which shortcut reader class to use. If required, you may also instantiate the specific reader classes and use them directly.

There is no need to instantiate this class - all methods are static.

getShortcutReader

Returns a shortcut reader class appropriate for reading the specified file (based on the extension).

Parameters:
file - The shortcut file.
Returns:
The appropriate reader class, or null if the file does not have a valid shortcut extension.

Checks to see if the file is a valid shortcut (based on the extension).

Parameters:
file - The shortcut file.
Returns:
True if the file extension indicates the file is a shortcut.

read

public static ShortcutContents read(File file)
                             throws FileNotFoundException,
                                    ShortcutReadException
Reads the specified file and extracts the contents. The type of shortcut file is determined by the file extension. For ".desktop" and ".url" files, the reader can handle unicode characters in the name and URL. ".webloc" files may contain unicode characters as well, although this functionality still requires more testing. The name returned by the readers is a guess. Many shortcut files do not contain a name/title embedded in the file. ".desktop" shortcuts may contain several embedded names with different encodings. Unfortunately, these names are not necessarily updated when the shortcut is renamed. It is difficult, if not impossible, to determine which is the correct name. As of right now, the reader will always return the name of the file as the name of the shortcut, although this may change in the future.

Parameters:
file - The file to read
Returns:
A ShortcutContents class containing the name and URL of the shortcut. Non-null. The name and URL will be non-null as well.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
ShortcutReadException - If any error occurs while reading the file.

readUrlString

public static String readUrlString(File file)
                            throws FileNotFoundException,
                                   ShortcutReadException
Similar to read(File), but only returns the URL.

Parameters:
file - The file to read
Returns:
The URL as a string. Non-null.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
ShortcutReadException - If any error occurs while reading the file.

ShortcutReadException

readUrlStringTrialAndError

public static String readUrlStringTrialAndError(InputStream stream)
                                         throws ShortcutReadException
Reads a shortcut of unknown type from the specified stream.

Because no file is available, here is no way to determine the shortcut type based on the extension. As the name implies, this method tries reading the stream as each type of shortcut to see which one works.

Because the input stream can only be read one time, this method uses a buffer to allow the stream contents to be repeatedly read. The default buffer size is indicated by DEFAULT_TRIAL_AND_ERROR_BUFFER_SIZE. Due to the limited buffer size, there is a small chance that this method will not work. The buffer size may be increased in size by using readUrlStringTrialAndError(InputStream, int).

Parameters:
stream - The stream to read. The stream is not closed.
Returns:
The URL as a string. Non-null.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException
ShortcutReadException - If the shortcut type cannot be determined, or if any error occurs while reading the file.

readUrlStringTrialAndError

public static String readUrlStringTrialAndError(InputStream stream,
                                                int bufferSize)
                                         throws ShortcutReadException
Reads a shortcut of unknown type from the specified stream. See readUrlStringTrialAndError(InputStream) for details.

Parameters:
stream - The stream to read. The stream is not closed.
bufferSize - The buffer size to use when reading the stream.
Returns:
The URL as a string. Non-null.
Throws:
ShortcutReadException - If the shortcut type cannot be determined, or if any error occurs while reading the file.
